definition: to ally/to unite/to join/(poetry) antithetical couplet

sentences.english: She is to be costarred with Katherine again.
sentences.chinese: 她将应邀再次与凯瑟琳联袂主演。

sentences.english: Today, the history enables the two countries with ancient civilizations to join hands for greater prosperity.
sentences.chinese: 如今，历史再次让两个文明古国联袂牵手，再创辉煌。

sentences.english: She costarred with her twin sister in a new film.
sentences.chinese: 她和她的孪生姊妹联袂主演一部新影片。

definition: leading (role)/heading list of signatories/leading actors (in a show)/starring
hand in hand/to join hands/to collaborate
to carry/to take along/to bring along/to hold (hands)/also pr. [xi1]
(honorific) your kind efforts/thanks to your help
lit. to join hands/to act together
(of a commanding officer) to keep watch/to oversee
to bring up the rear/to provide support/to hold the lines
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to enumerate in detail/to explain clearly
to get together all at once
